title: Migrant deaths Cochise County

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Migrant deaths Cochise County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. Specifically, I am seeking access to the following information regarding migrant remains that have been documented in your Medical Examiner Officer or Cochise County Sheriff's files for fiscal years 2020 - 2022:

Age
Sex
Body condition
Coordinates where the body was located
Country of origin
Cause of death
I understand that these records may contain sensitive information, and I assure you that any information provided will be used solely for legitimate research purposes.

Please inform me of any fees associated with this request, and I would be happy to provide payment if necessary. Additionally, please let me know if there are any limitations on the amount of information that can be provided, or if you require any further information from me to process this request.

Please do not hesitate to contact me at gvillegasrmz@gmail.com if you require further information or clarification.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gabriela Villegas

title: Duanesburg Central School Superintendent's Conference Days

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Duanesburg Central School Superintendent's Conference Days
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide the following:

-A copy of any and all the information pertaining to the four (4) Duanesburg Superintendent's Conference Days on September 6, 2022, on October 7, 2022, on January 27, 2023, and on March 17, 2023.
-A copy of any and all handouts provided by the Duanesburg Superintendent to school staff during the Duanesburg Superintendent's Conference Days on September 6, 2022, on October 7, 2022, on January 27, 2023, and on March 17, 2023.
-A copy of any and all handouts provided by any and all guests who attended the Duanesburg Superintendent's Conference Days on September 6, 2022, on October 7, 2022, on January 27, 2023, and on March 17, 2023.
-A copy of any and all official emails received and sent by the Duanesburg Superintendent to school staff and school guests pertaining to the Duanesburg Superintendent's Conference Days on September 6, 2022, on October 7, 2022, on January 27, 2023, and on March 17, 2023.
-A copy of any and all digital information used by the Duanesburg Superintendent during the Duanesburg Superintendent's Conference Days on September 6, 2022, on October 7, 2022, on January 27, 2023, and on March 17, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Clifford Bradshaw

title: Code Violations in Twin Parks Buildings

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Code Violations in Twin Parks Buildings
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to see the reports from 2017-2021 of the Twin Parks building in New York City. I want to see the requests pending and how many were disregarded before the fire tragically took lives. I would like to see the specific requests.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miller Romm

title: Takings Cases Off the Calendar

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Takings Cases Off the Calendar
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In April 2022, Chief Immigration Judge Tracy Short issued guidance by email to immigration judges authorizing taking certain cases off of the court's calendar. However, while that email message included 6 categories of cases that should be de-calendared, we have consistently received these notices only in one category of case that was not listed in Tracy Short's April, 2022 email. Specifically, the only cases being taken off the country in Kansas City, where I practice, are cancellation of removal cases set for trial. 

To better understand what explains this apparent deviation from the current policy, I am requesting any guidance since April 21, 2022 to Immigration Judges about which cases should be removed from the court's calendar. This may include policy memoranda or email messages. Assuming this guidance was disseminated to the "All of OCIJ HDQ and Courts (EOIR)" email address, please search that account for the phrase "taking cases off." If that guidance was disseminated in some other manner, please contact me to discuss possible search terms.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Hoppock

title: Furry Appeal Meta (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Furry Appeal Meta (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records documenting FBI's search referenced in OIP's decision in Appeal No. A-2023-00488.  By way of context, OIP states in the decision that while the appeal was pending, FBI "conducted a [further] search but it could locate no responsive records subject to the FOIA in its files."  I am looking for records that would show what repositories and files were searched and what parameters were used for the search.  I'm not sure if these would be in processing notes or documented elsewhere. Please contact me if you need more clarity on what I am requesting.

2. The communications and notes of any communications between FBI and OIP pertaining to Appeal No. A-2023-00488 or request NFP-143322.

3. OIP's policies and procedures applicable to communications between OIP and an agency that is the subject of an appeal, while the appeal is pending.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Topic

    locate no responsive records subject to the FOIA in its files." I am looking
    for records that would show what repositories and files were searched and
    what parameters were used for the search. I'm not sure if these would be in
    processing notes or documented elsewhere. Please contact me if you need more
    clarity on what I am requesting.
    
    2. The communications and notes of any communications between FBI and OIP
    pertaining to Appeal No. A-2023-00488 or request NFP-143322.
    
    3. OIP's policies and procedures applicable to communications between OIP
    and an agency that is the subject of an appeal, while the appeal is pending.
    
    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and
    this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
    
    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me
    of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the
    request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM
    if not.
    
    Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look
    forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days,
    as the statute requires.
    
    Sincerely,
    
    Matthew Topic
    
    Upload documents directly:
    https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Ffurry-appeal-meta-federal-bureau-of-investigation-143196%252F%253Femail%253Defoia%252540subscriptions.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2IK4I9uIAF_1jezhuonG71E%3A1pepQb%3A17QUc-ZauotCUA_Y4RDiN_E3L2O1Ykw2-swzqQUkhI4

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

pooanon

title: CJ Emails 2017-2018

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CJ Emails 2017-2018
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

emails from village of Niles email addresses between August 1, 2017 and August 1, 2018 that include any of the following keywords in the subject line and/or body:

– "Carol Johnson"
– "C. Johnson"
– "Ms. Johnson"
– "CJ"

Please include any attachments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Niles Coalition

This request will be processed accordingly.  Village of Niles FOIA Officer    Request #23-207. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Village of Niles.

Technical support: See our help page

title: Roster and hire dates

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Roster and hire dates
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A roster of current law enforcement officers at this agency, with full names and hire dates. Please provide these records in their current format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Josh Chamberlain.

title: Incident Report- Doug Zammett -Interlaken, NY (Seneca County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Incident Report- Doug Zammett -Interlaken, NY (Seneca County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Seeking all police incident reports and associated documents for August 16/17th, 1985 involving a nuisance call on Doug Zammett at/around 8397 Seneca Street,  Interlaken, NY 14847.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jolynn Rice

communications.subject: RE: [Possible-Spam]  New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Incident Report- Doug Zammett -Interlaken, NY (Seneca County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:
The Seneca County Sheriff’s Office is unable to fulfill your FOIA request. We follow the NYS Records Retention guidelines which requires us to hold reports for 25 years. We currently do not have incident reports past 1997.

Danielle O’Mara
Seneca County Sheriff’s Office
Records Dept.
(315) 220-3428

[Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Montgomery County Police Records 
 
Dear Deborah Levi 
 
Thank you for registering with Montgomery County Police Department Records Center. 
 
Your Login ID is:  143076-74390563@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
Please login to the Records Center to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HVTrnXBGxMLa0FmF532MTiR7jD3x7Gu3al0-2BFh2EejSdapnGZ-2BVNzgC8ozToJBorS7RUOfms-2BCf-2FiBFSAZxVfsc-3DVOjn_x41zT07I1xO6t5-2BtsSToobI8mMTMDJetMUqg9G8XCyYhC4foHVb1brmNV6ER0rKx9xGIacdOtqxv1ZhvCrb-2BjBNPXxcn16KeKXifsEZuUDvd3gw5AoY7Fq-2FRB9zSbAqH6m4AoI0MmgKHbHLcx4BkAKk2Ku0C95fC26Zv-2BOZ-2FhD2I-2B0crd5tp9bkjUwhy7r9X6aKpHp4IKncEshV80vXcBL2s7FcS27VT1wL-2BBZNC7CU-3D) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

communications.subject: Other Public Records Request :: R027885-032123
communications.communication:
Montgomery County Police Records 
 
Dear Deborah Levi: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Montgomery County Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Maryland’s Public Information Act (PIA). Your request was received in this office on 3/21/2023 and given the reference number R027885-032123 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records for every sworn officer and civilian member of the Montgomery County Police Department for fiscal year 2022:
1. First and last name;
2. Unique sequence number;
3. Race;
4. Gender;
5. Hire date;
6. 2022 salary;
7. 2022 overtime

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Alternatively, please consider waiving any fees, pursuant to § 4-206(e)(2)(ii) of the General Provisions Article, as this request is on behalf of individuals served by the Maryland Office of the Public Defender, a state government agency, which solely serves indigent citizens of Maryland. As a result, my request for the above-listed public records is in the public interest. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Deborah Levi
Director of Special Litigation
Maryland Office of the Public Defender
(443) 272-1068

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fmontgomery-county-police-department-672%252Frequest-for-your-agencys-2022-roster-salary-data-montgomery-county-police-department-143076%252F%253Femail%253DMCPD_PIO%252540montgomerycountymd.gov&url_auth_token=AAAc7CXFtidmrwTD5hvauCBPHt8%3A1penSj%3AlIFNA7yrq0Eg3tn08js35IDZuOsv85RIdIZGwtB74uA 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: Maryland’s Public Information Act (PIA) does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
Montgomery County Police Department 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HVTrnXBGxMLa0FmF532MTiR7jD3x7Gu3al0-2BFh2EejSdqoGRZa-2BLtBcKerrhNbdJ00KHuRvFEkkF94-2BILGfhlprTU-2FtIY8vrbbLQmQhWYnAZh9Fr_x41zT07I1xO6t5-2BtsSToobI8mMTMDJetMUqg9G8XCyYhC4foHVb1brmNV6ER0rKxpvF8rrTn88OiVcLeSUHo4qUpivyOtDRFeRqt-2BJ6IAfehfjev4AK-2F6bqPavP7nXhMtS37-2BlELaVucDNk89ycF3OogzlOFN-2FlXboSZsOIwXKpm-2Fib5gxpfTQ1Dt6kPKPphkASwQc4E5iTVGGzBukzryVA6UXwOdJ-2BvJb3gzDWbLhu2jMuHAlL66839l1YxgpcETt82RPimRcvOmyOWZd5B734NlUjW0rKCSCPamnpNZL8mqfhqpjIIHsyhJ6z6y1Vvd07AC2UupvYHkK2hDLeEz9lWBC4-2BbxxyJVgS3JYjYmI6uOAxEkvyOjppIe-2BULX5OXesyWUZ6fPqrtZtqGSmKaS5T8UZjMa7tm-2BviNFOik-2BY-3D) 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://records-montgomerycountymd.govqa.us/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=27885 (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HVTrnXBGxMLa0FmF532MTiR7jD3x7Gu3al0-2BFh2EejSdclSWNuhZkGcnbVjgDHGZZq3INQyXxtNfXNvBpWTuGyNDlubRZe1Q5OItYHlh11k9jk0M_x41zT07I1xO6t5-2BtsSToobI8mMTMDJetMUqg9G8XCyYhC4foHVb1brmNV6ER0rKxpvF8rrTn88OiVcLeSUHo4qUpivyOtDRFeRqt-2BJ6IAfehfjev4AK-2F6bqPavP7nXhMtS37-2BlELaVucDNk89ycF3OogzlOFN-2FlXboSZsOIwXKpm-2Fib5gxpfTQ1Dt6kPKPphkASwQc4E5iTVGGzBukzryVA6UXwOdJ-2BvJb3gzDWbLhu2jMuHAlL66839l1YxgpcEDjgn1RErAhUGUyikoVc6-2BiVBgCennLXcjFWUPks7iK8YpBsR-2BNnoYikA-2FlEihVQLE5EY7xr-2BQPGWpj-2FYnUrOrs6GJSmvIbsfaZ9hkgBphO2pl3AHXWNQR4QP3B7pAA8NUDPITyjfG0UkGqDzvvDGSvFPWLYbAYxoX8n1H-2Fx8H5Y-3D)
